Package chessboard

Class ChessBoard

java.lang.Object
chessboard.ChessBoard
public class ChessBoard extends Object
The ChessBoard class; Represented by a 2d-array Piece[][], the dimension of which is defined by its constants NO_OF_ROW and NO_OF_COLUMN. This array is empty by default, call the setPieceAt and setPlayerPiece methods to add Piece object(s) into the array. The ChessBoard class stores each Piece object in the array (perceived as a chess board) for piece tracking using coordinates. When being used in a ChessGame, it has the ability to flip 180 degree by repositioning all Piece objects in the array to correspond with the opposite player's point of view.
See Also:
  • Piece
  • ChessGame

    • clearPieces

      public void clearPieces()
      Clears all pieces from the chess board. This method creates a new Piece[][] to replace the old 2d-array.
